result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D McSorley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine to be paid in full on 01-13-2015.
Fine paid in full.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew D McSorley in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moved to dismiss count 3 with a plea to count 4.
Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 4.  Court conducted plea colloquy with defendant. 
Court found defendant guilty of count 4. Court dismissed and read-in count 3.

Court orders a fine of $473.50.  Defendant to pay full amount today.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Matthew D McSorley not in court.  
Case scheduled for 2:30 pm. and Matter called @ 2:55 pm.

Court orders a Stayed Warrant to the next court date.
MANDATORY APPEARANCE BY THE DEFENDANT IS REQUIRED OR A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED.
  Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with co-actor.

Defendant Matthew D McSorley in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
